*Director, EPIC-lab*  
ðŸ“§ joseph.bulbulia@vuw.ac.nz  
ðŸ”— [University Profile](https://people.wgtn.ac.nz/joseph.bulbulia)

Joseph Bulbulia is a Professor at the School of Psychology at Victoria University of Wellington, New Zealand. He leads the EPIC-lab and directs the Centre for Applied Cross-Cultural Research (CACR).

His research interests include religion, cooperation, and conflict, with a specialisation in methodologies for inferring causality from observational data.
:::

:::
::::

#### Main Projects

- **New Zealand Attitudes and Values Study (NZAVS):** Joseph is one of four members of the senior leadership team for the NZAVS, a longitudinal study that has measured the attitudes and values of 76,490 New Zealanders since 2009.
- **Pulotu Database:** He is a founding investigator for the Pulotu database. This project encompasses 116 Austronesian cultures and was purpose-built to study the evolution of religious beliefs and rituals during Pacific expansions and settlements.

#### Supervision

Joseph supervises students in a broad range of areas, including:


-   Personality and individual differences
-   Political psychology
-   Multi-dimensional well-being

#### Outside the Lab

When not working, Joseph is an avid distance runner.

## Research Fellow

### Dr. Inkuk Kim

:::: {.team-member}
::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="25%"}
![Dr. Inkuk Kim](images/team/inkuk-kim.jpg){.team-photo}
:::

::: {.column width="75%"}
Inkuk Kim is a Research Fellow at the Centre for Applied Cross-cultural Research and the School of Psychological Sciences at Victoria University of Wellington. His research focuses on fostering social cohesion to mitigate conflicts in multicultural societies, addressing climate change, and enhancing well-being. He is currently investigating the causal effects of trust in science on environmental attitudes and behaviours.

- **Project:** New Zealand Attitudes and Values Study (NZAVS)
- **Methods:** Longitudinal Modified Treatment Policies; Causal Machine Learning
- [ORCID Profile](https://orcid.org/0000-0002-7694-6295)
- [University Profile](https://people.wgtn.ac.nz/inkuk.kim)
- [GitHub](https://github.com/Inkuk-Kim)
:::

## PhD Students

### Jake Ireland

:::: {.team-member}
::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="25%"}
![Jake Ireland](images/team/jake-ireland.jpg){.team-photo}
:::

::: {.column width="75%"}
Jake graduated with a Bachelor of Science in Psychology and Mathematics from Victoria University of Wellington in 2020.  During his studies, he contributed to research on cross-cultural psychology, drug abuse, and face perception.  Since graduating, he has worked in cyber security and, since 2022, has been researching cultural evolution with the Causal Lab at Victoria University.  He completed his Honours in 2024 and began his PhD in 2025. Jake is investigating the co-evolution of religious and political culture in the Pacific.

- **Project:** Pulotu
- **Methods:** Causal Machine Learning
- [ORCID Profile](https://orcid.org/0000-0003-3030-1341)
